xhtml:div.xhtml:p: Today’s comic is all about transformation fetishes! A huge thank you to Rush for making us this fun gem of a comic. Covering a fetish is always tough to do! So getting a comical and joyous informative take like this means the world. Thank you again Rush!
Go transform and then hunt Rush down yourself. They’re pretty swell and deserve all the likes and follows you can spare!

entry.title: Erika Update!
entry.summary: Hey! Erika here! You still remember me, right? …I drew all the pink comics on this site for the first, like, 8.5 years of its existence? Yeah, that was me! Well it’s been a while and I thought it was about time I gave you all an update on where I’ve been and why! After […]

xhtml:div.class: post-10089 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-blog tag-intensive-outpatient-program tag-iop tag-lady-lovely-locks tag-letters-from-space-camp tag-memoir tag-mental-health tag-personal uentry post-blog postonpage-1 odd post-author-erikamoen_newlogin2021

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Hey! Erika here! You still remember me, right? …I drew all the pink comics on this site for the first, like, 8.5 years of its existence? Yeah, that was me! Well it’s been a while and I thought it was about time I gave you all an update on where I’ve been and why! After nearly a decade of working on OJST non-stop, I was feeling preeeeetty burnt out so I’ve been taking the last seven months to switch gears for my creativity and health. What does one do when they take a break from their long-running, deeply personal and frequently autobiographical comic series? One starts a new deeply personal, entirely autobiographical graphic novel, of course! over on my Patreon. I’m already past 70 rough pages! If you saw some of my earlier OJST comics that mentioned going through IOP and wondered “What the heck even is that?”, then Letters From Space Camp is for you! Aside from comics, I’ve also been making lots of cool shit too, with the Good Posts about them going up (mostly publicly! For free!) on my Patreon. Oh, and I just made an Instagram account to show off my extremely cool and not at all unnerving Lady Lovely Locks collection, despite intense discouragement from multiple people who love and care about me. Could an unstable person make….THIS? I rest my case. Anyway, I just wanted to let you guys know I’m still alive and I am just so incredibly grateful for and impressed by all the hard work that Matt and the newly assembled OJST Team have put into keeping this site running without my participation so that I have the time and energy to rest and work on my other projects for a bit. It’s been fascinating and heart-filling to see this place fill up with comics by other creators. Obviously, we’ve always showcased the work of additional cartoonists, but to see this site become more of a community-driven resource that shares an even wider variety of views and experiences, I dunno man, it just feels good. AND it’s making me inspired for my own OJST comics again??? I don’t wanna get anyone’s hopes up or anything, but there may be a comic or two from Matt and me again in the future. This time away from the regular grind has been good for my brain and heart. It’s helping me see what I loved about this place and career in the first place. I feel so lucky to have produced all the OJST comics that I did and I’m proud of what this site has become and I’m so, so, so grateful I have the support to take some time to myself to recover. Thank you everyone for sticking around and all your support over the years.
└ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): intensive outpatient program, IOP, lady lovely locks, letters from space camp, memoir, mental health, personal

entry.title: Why Not Both? by Menthaam
entry.summary: How beautiful is this comic by Menthaam? Every illustration is just so inviting and friendly while covering a subject that can be so fraught and confusing for so many. Menthaam isn’t alone in questioning their sexual orientation and bouncing back and forth between labels. For a good number of folks, their sexual orientation is fixed […]

xhtml:div.class: post-10079 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-comic category-guest-comic-2 category-interviews category-non-fiction category-sex-sexuality tag-anthro tag-anthropomorphic tag-attraction tag-autobio tag-bisexual tag-furries tag-furry tag-guest-2 tag-guest-comic tag-lgbt tag-menthaam tag-queer tag-sexuality uentry post-comic postonpage-1 odd post-author-matthewnolan_newlogin2021

xhtml:div.xhtml:p: How beautiful is this comic by Menthaam? Every illustration is just so inviting and friendly while covering a subject that can be so fraught and confusing for so many. Menthaam isn’t alone in questioning their sexual orientation and bouncing back and forth between labels. For a good number of folks, their sexual orientation is fixed and consistent, but for the rest of us… well, over the course of your life, you may be surprised to find out who you are attracted to, and that’s ok! Sexuality can be a flexible and surprising thing.

Added NOTE (3/22/22) Menthaam’s lovely comic today is all about her own personal experiences and definitions of sexuality growing up while living in Russia. We very much want a wide variety of people’s personal stories here on OJST, from different countries and cultures and translated from other languages, like this one.
Bisexuality can be far more than a binary and we strongly encourage you to research and learn more to find what works best for you. Check out some of our comics on sexuality and bisexuality!

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: └ Tags (chosen by OJST and artist/s): anthro, anthropomorphic, Attraction, autobio, Bisexual, furries, furry, guest, guest comic, lgbt, menthaam, queer, sexuality

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Hey! Erika here! You still remember me, right? …I drew all the pink comics on this site for the first, like, 8.5 years of its existence? Yeah, that was me! Well it’s been a while and I thought it was about time I gave you all an update on where I’ve been and why! After nearly a decade of working on OJST non-stop, I was feeling preeeeetty burnt out so I’ve been taking the last seven months to switch gears for my creativity and health. One starts a new deeply personal, entirely autobiographical graphic novel, of course! over on my Patreon. I’m already past 70 rough pages! If you saw some of my earlier OJST comics that mentioned going through IOP and wondered “What the heck even is that?”, then Letters From Space Camp is for you! Aside from comics, I’ve also been making lots of cool shit too, with the Good Posts about them going up (mostly publicly! For free!) on my Patreon. Oh, and I just made an Instagram account to show off my extremely cool and not at all unnerving Lady Lovely Locks collection, despite intense discouragement from multiple people who love and care about me. Could an unstable person make….THIS? I rest my case. Anyway, I just wanted to let you guys know I’m still alive and I am just so incredibly grateful for and impressed by all the hard work that Matt and the newly assembled OJST Team have put into keeping this site running without my participation so that I have the time and energy to rest and work on my other projects for a bit. It’s been fascinating and heart-filling to see this place fill up with comics by other creators. Obviously, we’ve always showcased the work of additional cartoonists, but to see this site become more of a community-driven resource that shares an even wider variety of views and experiences, I dunno man, it just feels good. AND it’s making me inspired for my own OJST comics again??? I don’t wanna get anyone’s hopes up or anything, but there may be a comic or two from Matt and me again in the future. This time away from the regular grind has been good for my brain and heart. It’s helping me see what I loved about this place and career in the first place. I feel so lucky to have produced all the OJST comics that I did and I’m proud of what this site has become and I’m so, so, so grateful I have the support to take some time to myself to recover. Thank you everyone for sticking around and all your support over the years.

entry.title: A Deal With The Devil by Luny
entry.summary: Short, silly, and super duper sexy. I adore it and hope you do too =D Last year, while on the hunt for artists to hit up for comics, I stumbled across this gem of a short comic* by Luny (in fact, if you enjoyed today’s comic I highly recommend you peek at the tweet for […]

xhtml:img.alt: A Deal With The Devil by Luny
xhtml:img.title: A Deal With The Devil by Luny

xhtml:div.class: post-10066 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-comic category-smutty-comic category-guest-comic-2 tag-deal tag-devil tag-fae tag-fantasy tag-fiction tag-guest-2 tag-guest-comic tag-lun tag-luny tag-pregnancy uentry post-comic postonpage-1 odd post-author-matthewnolan_newlogin2021

xhtml:div.xhtml:p: Short, silly, and super duper sexy. I adore it and hope you do too =D

Last year, while on the hunt for artists to hit up for comics, I stumbled across this gem of a short comic* by Luny (in fact, if you enjoyed today’s comic I highly recommend you peek at the tweet for some bonus art ;D ). I instantly fell in love with the idea and had to reach out and ask if he’d be game to make us a whole comic around it. Luckily he said yes!
Hit up Luny on his socials and Patreon! Tell him he’s fantastic =D
*A short comic that was built from a tumblr post that Luny made sure to get permission to draw up for today’s comic =).

xhtml:div.data-a2a-title: A Deal With The Devil by Luny

entry.title: Ghost Scent by Rithion
entry.summary: We’ve got a saucy, sexy one for you this week! By the talented Rithion! I think it’s really fun to see what Rithion did here, trying to showing something as abstract as a ghostly scent in a visual comic form. =D Rithion worked on this, gosh, I don’t know 4? 5? months ago, right in […]

xhtml:div.class: post-10052 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-comic category-smutty-comic category-guest-comic-2 tag-fantasizing tag-fantasy tag-fiction tag-guest-2 tag-guest-comic tag-long-distance tag-long-distance-relationship tag-masturbation tag-memory tag-olfactory tag-rithion tag-scent tag-smell tag-trans tag-transgender uentry post-comic postonpage-1 odd post-author-matthewnolan_newlogin2021

xhtml:div.xhtml:p: We’ve got a saucy, sexy one for you this week! By the talented Rithion! I think it’s really fun to see what Rithion did here, trying to showing something as abstract as a ghostly scent in a visual comic form. =D

Rithion worked on this, gosh, I don’t know 4? 5? months ago, right in the middle of all that scrambling we had to do while we rethought OJST and built the team! So I’m really happy to finally share the end comic with you all. Hope you all like it!

entry.summary: Hey everyone, thanks so much for reading this very personal story of mine. It’s something I’ve dealt with for a long time, realizing that what my late mother did was wrong and really affected how I grew up. I’ve come out of it all as a better person and now I draw porn for work! […]

xhtml:div.xhtml:p: Hey everyone, thanks so much for reading this very personal story of mine. It’s something I’ve dealt with for a long time, realizing that what my late mother did was wrong and really affected how I grew up. I’ve come out of it all as a better person and now I draw porn for work!

Matthew here with a bonus link:

entry.title: Refuge by Hien Pham
entry.summary: It’s ok to hurt. It’s ok to need time. Try to be kind to yourself. Hien Pham is our artist today, showing us all today how powerful and important comics are. I can’t thank him enough for sharing such a moving personal story with us and I truly feel honored to have it on the […]

xhtml:div.class: post-10018 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-comic category-favorites category-guest-comic-2 category-health category-hienpham category-non-fiction tag-autobio tag-break-up tag-breakup tag-breathe tag-canine tag-crying tag-dog tag-guest-2 tag-guest-comic tag-healing tag-heartbreak tag-hien-pham tag-hienpham tag-process tag-processing tag-refuge tag-rescue tag-rest tag-shelter tag-tears tag-trauma tag-walk uentry post-comic postonpage-1 odd post-author-matthewnolan_newlogin2021

xhtml:div.xhtml:p:
It’s ok to hurt. It’s ok to need time.
Try to be kind to yourself.

Hien Pham is our artist today, showing us all today how powerful and important comics are. I can’t thank him enough for sharing such a moving personal story with us and I truly feel honored to have it on the site. If you want to see the rest of his OJST comics, check them out here. Then go drop him a follow or two on his socials. I promise you won’t regret it.

entry.title: Seeing My Body As Nonbinary by Christine Suggs
entry.summary: Christine Suggs tells us the story of who they are and what their body has meant to them over the years! A lovely beat-by-beat play of growth and exploration and most importantly (I think) kindness for oneself. That final panel just hits so hard! I hope you all love it as much as we do […]

xhtml:img.alt: Seeing My Body As Nonbinary by Christine Suggs
xhtml:img.title: Seeing My Body As Nonbinary by Christine Suggs

xhtml:div.class: post-10004 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-comic category-favorites category-guest-comic-2 category-interviews category-non-fiction category-sex-sexuality tag-autobio tag-bisexual tag-body-image tag-body-positive tag-christine-suggs tag-fat tag-fat-positive tag-gender tag-gender-euphoria tag-gender-identity tag-genderqueer tag-guest-2 tag-guest-comic tag-nonbinary tag-queer tag-trans tag-transgender uentry post-comic postonpage-1 odd post-author-matthewnolan_newlogin2021

xhtml:div.xhtml:p: Christine Suggs tells us the story of who they are and what their body has meant to them over the years! A lovely beat-by-beat play of growth and exploration and most importantly (I think) kindness for oneself. That final panel just hits so hard!
I hope you all love it as much as we do and go tell Christine how fantastic they are!
Hoping you all had a lovely Valentine’s! Erika and I sat in and ate reheated Ikea meatballs… the perfect night ;D
